Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அந்தணர் நூற்கும் அறத்திற்கும் ஆதியாய் நின்றது மன்னவன் கோல்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The sceptre of the king is the firm support of the Vedas of the Brahmin, and of all virtues therein described.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A massive, unshakable royal sceptre ('மன்னவன் கோல்') stands firm like the axis mundi or world pillar.
Layered_Composition.Midground: This sceptre is the foundation ('ஆதியாய்') from which everything else grows. On one side, the sacred texts of the wise ('அந்தணர் நூல்') are shown supported by a branch growing from the sceptre. On the other side, all virtuous deeds ('அறம்') are depicted as flourishing flowers and fruits on another branch growing from the same sceptre.
Layered_Composition.Background: A stable and enlightened society, where both learning and virtue thrive because of the foundational stability provided by just rule.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A just king's rule is the fundamental basis upon which both sacred knowledge and all virtues are built and sustained.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The sceptre as the foundational pillar or tree of life is the central metaphor. The sacred texts and virtuous deeds are shown literally growing from and being supported by it.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A powerful, divine light emanates from the sceptre itself, illuminating the sacred texts and the symbols of virtue. The palette is noble and serene, with golds, whites, and deep, stable earth tones.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A low-angle, centered shot that emphasizes the foundational role and immense scale of the sceptre.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The sceptre is the primary source of light, symbolizing justice as the light of civilization.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Mythological art, symbolic still life with narrative elements.

Cultural_Anchors: The King's Sceptre as the Foundation ('ஆதியாய் நின்றது கோல்')
